snippet: Most residents of Bangui, the capital city, have picked up and fled amid the nation’s low-boil civil war, including more than 100,000 who moved to one chaotic camp by the airport.
abstract: Most of the residents of Bangui, Central African Republic, have fled to the outskirts of the city and more than 100,000 live in a chaotic camp by the airport; move is unmistakable evidence that the troubled country is still in the grip of a low-boil civil war.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Most residents of Bangui, the capital city, have picked up and fled amid the nation’s low-boil civil war, including more than 100,000 who moved to one chaotic camp by the airport.

headline.main: Tent City in Central African Republic Swells as Violence Grips Capital
headline.print_headline: African Tent City Swells as Violence Grips Capital
